definition: to persuade
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: He prevailed on the lieutenant to send in a short note.
sentences.chinese: 他说动那个副官，递上了一张简短的便条进去。

sentences.english: Maybe I could convince them to start serving biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 也许我能说动他们开始卖饼干呢。

sentences.english: The father finally dissuaded his son from leaving school.
sentences.chinese: 那父亲终于说动了他的儿子不辍学。

sentences.english: I can't believe you let him talk you into this.
sentences.chinese: 我真不相信你能被他说动了。

sentences.english: "People are getting harder to impress," Steinberg said.

definition: prevail/convince
to incite
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to purchase/to bribe
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to urge sb on
to persuade/persuasion/to advise
to get sb to understand/to persuade
to coax/to beguile/to win over
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

definition: to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
to give a nod of approval
to intercede/to plead for sb else
